name: Sriracha Honey Chicken Pizza
description: In my dictionary, sriracha means spicy goodness. This pizza has just enough sweetness to complement the spicy goodness of the sriracha. This recipe was made in a Panasonic CIO.
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons sriracha sauce, or more to taste
2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 3/4-inch pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat Panasonic Countertop Induction Oven to Medium on the "Grill" setting.
Mix honey and sriracha sauce together in a bowl.
Spread chicken on the grill pan and set the timer for 4 minutes. Turn chicken after 2 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir into the honey mixture.
Unroll pizza crust flat onto the grill pan. Spread ranch dressing on top. Remove chicken from the honey mixture and place on top of the ranch dressing. Sprinkle Colby Jack cheese over chicken.
Place pizza in the oven and press "Auto Cook." Select the frozen pizza setting, 12-inch size. Allow pizza to cook until timer goes off, about 13 minutes. Cut pizza into slices.

review.reviewBody: This was so delicious! Great recipe. Cooked in a regular oven. We reduced the honey and added a little extra sriracha. I would definitely taste as you go! Cooked perfectly and topped with green onion cilantro and a drizzle of sriracha.

I do not have the oven called for in this recipe but the combo of flavors made me attempt it in a regular oven. The base ingredients lend themselves easily to adjustments based on personal tastes. More or less ranch chicken or cheese. Even the chicken sauce can easily be heated up or toned down. 400 degree oven for 12 minutes on a parchment lined jelly roll pan worked perfect for me. Will have fun playing around with the ratios of ingredients but the recipe as is is A in our family's opinion.

What a great idea for a pizza! This was fantastic... and like no pizza that we've ever had before. I loved the sweet yet spicy flavors you get from the honey/sriracha mixture. I made half a recipe as I was using the rest of the pizza dough for another pizza recipe. Because of this I used the 9" pizza setting on my Panasonic countertop induction oven rather than the 12" setting. It turned out perfect! I loved how the bottom crust had the grill marks from the grill pan and it was nice and crispy. I will be making this again in the near future but will be making the full recipe for sure. Yum!

I made this pizza for lunch on garlic Indian nan flatbread today it turned out really good I used mozzarella cheese and some toco cheese I had since I didn t have any cheddar jack cheese it was very tasty I would add more Sriracha to the honey and a little less honey to the mix since I like some spice? I totally would make it again thanks for sharing the recipe

Loved this pizza! We made our own crust and baked in a regular oven. Didn’t have Colby Jack but used a combo of sharp cheddar and Monterey Jack. I did use half the amount of honey as others recommended, and I’m glad I did. Sprinkled with fresh cilantro before serving. This is a keeper!

Excellent! Another great recipe for the CIO! Seriously the flavors in this are wonderful- I was a little skeptical about the ranch base as that's not normally my thing but went ahead because of all of the glowing reviews and I'm glad that I did. That honey sriracha mixture? I could eat that with a spoon. Seriously amazing. I drizzled most of the extra over the top before baking and reserved a little extra for dipping. I made chicken nuggets for my son for dinner and even made an extra one for myself just so I could dip it in that amazing sauce! I followed the recipe exactly except I did add some sliced green onion. Definitely a keeper!
I made my own pizza dough and then used parchment paper because I like a really thin pizza dough. Worked out great! Very easy and great flavor. We loved this.
Holy cow! Don't even have to use refrigerated dough. I used two Caulipower crusts and cooked at 425 for 12 minutes. This was really good.

Like other reviewers I cut the honey in half - and that was still too sweet. To compensate I added some Sambal Oelek (Asian pepper paste). I usually follow recipes more to the recipe on the first run but since I m not a fan of ranch dressing I subbed low fat sour cream and added spices used in ranch (onion powder garlic parsley dill). I also mixed all the sauces together
